CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed Case Resolved The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) investigated and determined the following:    BWSC responding to an emergency leak repair at 46 Garden St needed to excavate the sidewalk in order to make the repair.      Utility Companies have 60 days to permanently restore the sidewalk.  Since the work was done in the fall  and we do not allow any permanent restoration work between December 1st and April 1st  the bricks will be restored in the Spring.      The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors.    The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair.    The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work caused.    Sincerely      Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed Case Noted This was not an "invalid" case. DPW drove by the house  saw the crack  and explained to me that they thought as it warmed up the sidewalk would perhaps settle down a little so that the crack would not be as large. They dissuaded me from asphalt saying "You don't want that; it would track in your house." Since I had already researched repairing a sidewalk crack  I knew I could use Sakrete to fix it. Another workman explained another way to fix it with caulk and sand. Another workman told it it had happened all over the city which I knew because I had walked down Boylston Street recently and tripped more than once on unlevel pavement.  I take exception with your use of the term "invalid." Closed would be a more appropriate term.
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

Closed date : 2015-05-30 08:56:52.027 Case Resolved Mark Cardarelli called the constituent and explained that the property owners were repairing their cellar that jets out underneath the sidewalk.  The city refers to them as area ways.  The property owners are not only responsible for the area way but the sidewalk above the area way.      This particular area way was so unsafe that the area way and sidewalks needed to be done over.      This is a very expensive and logistically difficult repair.  That is why it is taking so long.      The city apologizes for the inconvenience.    Any questions or concerns you may contact the number listed below.    .Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office

If you feel that there is an immediate safety concern at this location  please contact 617-635-4500 so that maintenance can be performed to make the location safer until the reconstruction can be started. Since there was a moratorium on concrete and brick repair work until April 15th  the patch had to remain in asphalt. CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-08-26 10:53:50.207 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU)  surveyed all of Beacon Hill this Summer to identify any asphalt patches on sidewalks left behind by utility companies and private contractors.    A list was generated and the individual permittees were  contacted and ordered to apply for a permit to restore the sidewalks.    You probably already seen many sidewalks in asphalt now restored to its original condition.    There are still some left to be done  and the City is tracking those locations.    Thank you for your patience.    For any questions or concerns  please contact the number listed below    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed Case Resolved Dear Constituent      The Boston Public Works Department Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) has identified all the locations in Beacon Hill that were left in asphalt by various Utility companies and private contractors.    Since there was a Winter Moratorium on concrete and brick repair work until April 15th  the patches had to remain in asphalt.     The CIU has notified all permitttees with asphalt sidewalks that the repairs must be made by June 15th.    The locations have been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors.     The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair.     Any questions or concerns you can contact the number listed below.     Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli   Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance   Boston Public Works Department   617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-11-10 13:23:01.27 Case Noted Duplicate of Case #101000075406.    Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.    Staff from the Boston Public Works Department has reviewed the location and we are of the opinion that the location is a candidate for reconstruction.     Your request and location has been added to the master list of future reconstruction projects. Currently  the wait time for a reconstruction project of this nature can be up to five (5) years.     If you feel that there is an immediate safety concern at this location  please contact 617-635-4500 so that maintenance can be performed to make the location safer until the reconstruction can be started.    In the meantime  you may contact the Public Works Department Engineering Division at 617-635-4968 for information on your request.  Again  we appreciate and thank you for your interest in public safety and the welfare of your community.

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-05-15 10:02:11.83 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     National Grid responding to a gas leak underneath the sidewalk in front of 10 Millmont St.activated an emergency permit.    Emergency work must be performed no matter what time of day or night in the interest of public safety and the protection of private property.    The hot top patch you see is temporary.    The City requires permittees to restore the sidewalk to its original condition within 60 days of completion of the work.     National Grid has been notified by the CIU of the 60 day requirement    The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors.    If within the 60 day interim period the inspector finds that the asphalt patch is uneven  and not smooth and level  the permittee will be required to re-do the asphalt until the permanent repair is scheduled.    The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair.    Any questions or concerns about this location you may contact the number listed below.    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-05-28 09:35:39.513 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector investigated and determined the following:    Eversource Electric in early April installed a service into 51 Brookline Ave.      Late last Fall National Grid also installed a service at this location.    Permittees have 60 days to restore the sidewalk after the completion of their work.    In addition since no concrete work could be done between Nov 15 and April 15th  all work done in that time period will be restored within 60 days of the opening of the  2015 construction season (April 15th)    Both utilities have been notified to restore the sidewalks to concrete by June 15th.    The CIU has added the locations to its data base that tracks  utility sidewalk work needing permanent restoration.    The CIU will monitor the progress of the work.     The City apologizes for the inconvenience for this necessary work.     Any questions or concerns you make contact the number listed below.    Sincerely      Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office      Any questions or concerns you make contact the number listed below.    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office

National Grid has been notified that they must  saw cut and dig out existing patch and leave a square asphalt patch within 14 days .     The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors.    The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair.    Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-07-18 07:49:44.377 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Department Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) has identified the sidewalk left in asphalt as belonging to BWSC.    The City requires permittees to restore the sidewalk to its original condition within 60 days of completion of the work.      BWSC has been notified by the CIU of the 60 day requirement    We have ordered that bricks be removed to a safe location until the repairs are made.    The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors.    If the inspector finds that the asphalt patch is uneven  and not smooth and level the permittees will be required to re-do the asphalt until the permanent repair is scheduled.    The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair.    Any questions or concerns about this location you may contact the number listed below.    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-07-02 09:01:41.783 Duplicate of Existing Case As I stated yesterday  we have this location and we will repair it when we get to East Boston.  The City yards in East Boston are not equipped to repair sidewalks permanently  they only try to make them safe.  As the Engineer in charge of sidewalks and with East Boston as my home town  I make it a point to do as much work as possible.  My sidewalk crew is NOT in East Boston.  We have NOT been there and will not be there for a few months.    As it is now  we have 3400 requests to repair sidewalks in the City of Boston.  The turn around time is 19 months.  So for a request to come in 6 months ago prior to one of the worse winters we have ever had  and not to be immediately repaired should be understood and expected.    When we get to East Boston  I will do my best to take care of this situation.  If you have any other questions or concerns  please feel free to call me.      Michael Somers  Senior Civil Engineer  Construction Management Division  Boston Public Works  617-635-3831  Michael.Somers@Boston.gov
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

Closed date : 2015-07-18 07:50:01.547 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Department Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) has identified the sidewalk left in asphalt as belonging to BWSC.    The City requires permittees to restore the sidewalk to its original condition within 60 days of completion of the work.      BWSC has been notified by the CIU of the 60 day requirement    We have ordered that bricks be removed to a safe location until the repairs are made.    The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors. The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair.    Any questions or concerns about this location you may contact the number listed below.    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-12-18 12:57:34.377 Case Noted Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.    Staff from the Boston Public Works Department has reviewed the location and we are of the opinion that the location is a candidate for reconstruction.     Your request and location has been added to the master list of future reconstruction projects. Currently  the wait time for a reconstruction project of this nature can be up to five (5) or more years.    If you feel that there is an immediate safety concern at this location  please contact 617-635-4500 so that maintenance can be performed to make the location safer until the reconstruction can be started.    In the meantime  you may contact the Public Works Department Engineering Division at 617-635-4968 for information on your request.  Again  we appreciate and thank you for your interest in public safety and the welfare of your community.

Staff from the Boston Public Works Department has reviewed the location and we are of the opinion that the location is a candidate for reconstruction.     Your request and location has been added to the master list of future reconstruction projects. Currently  the wait time for a reconstruction project of this nature can be up to five (5) years.     If you feel that there is an immediate safety concern at this location  please contact 617-635-4500 so that maintenance can be performed to make the location safer until the reconstruction can be started.    In the meantime  you may contact the Public Works Department Engineering Division at 617-635-4968 for information on your request.  Again  we appreciate and thank you for your interest in public safety and the welfare of your community.
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-12-17 17:45:35.687 Case Noted Duplicate of Case #101000136270.    Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.    Staff from the Boston Public Works Department has reviewed the location and we are of the opinion that the location is a candidate for reconstruction.     Your request and location has been added to the master list of future reconstruction projects. Currently  the wait time for a reconstruction project of this nature can be up to five (5) or more years.    If you feel that there is an immediate safety concern at this location  please contact 617-635-4500 so that maintenance can be performed to make the location safer until the reconstruction can be started.    In the meantime  you may contact the Public Works Department Engineering Division at 617-635-4968 for information on your request.  Again  we appreciate and thank you for your interest in public safety and the welfare of your community.
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

Closed date : 2015-09-02 09:09:51.17 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector investigated and determined the following:    There was a major water leak on Bowdoin St.    The pipe belonged to a building owned by the State of Massachusetts.    The City reviewed the damage with the State and marked off areas to be repaired.    A contractor has been hired and the work is scheduled to start after Labor Day.    They will replace all the bricks damaged by the water leak as well as resurface the entire roadway between Derne and Cambridge.    For any questions or concerns  please contact the number listed below    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office

Closed date : 2015-08-24 10:53:42.76 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector met with the contractor and ordered that they place sidewalk closed signs  at Dorchester St on the side where the fence is placed    This will warn pedestrians to walk on the other side.    He also placed barricades in front of the fence.    The problem is because Middle St is so narrow if we required a temporary path of travel into Middle St to walk around the fence it would affect parking and emergency vehicles.    People need to cross at Dorchester St.    For any questions or concerns  please contact the number listed below    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office

Closed date : 2015-09-10 09:41:05.963 Case Resolved   Dear Constituent      The Boston Public Works Department Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) has identified the sidewalk left in asphalt as belonging to National Grid.     Permittees are required to restore the sidewalk within sixty days of completion of their work.    This work is less than 60 days old.      National Grid has been notified that the sidewalks must be restored within the sixty days.    The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors.     The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair.     Any questions or concerns you can contact the number listed below.     Mark Cardarelli   Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance   Boston Public Works Department   617-635-4951 Office

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-12-18 13:21:15.077 Case Noted Duplicate of Case #101001059336.    Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.    Staff from the Boston Public Works Department has reviewed the location and we are of the opinion that the location is a candidate for reconstruction.     Your request and location has been added to the master list of future reconstruction projects. Currently  the wait time for a reconstruction project of this nature can be up to five (5) or more years.    If you feel that there is an immediate safety concern at this location  please contact 617-635-4500 so that maintenance can be performed to make the location safer until the reconstruction can be started.    In the meantime  you may contact the Public Works Department Engineering Division at 617-635-4968 for information on your request.  Again  we appreciate and thank you for your interest in public safety and the welfare of your community.
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-11-04 09:01:17.533 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Department Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) has identified the sidewalk left in asphalt as belonging to National Grid.    Sidewalks are required to be restored within 60 days.    This work was done in October    Since the Public Works has a moratorium on all concrete pour work beginning in late November  this sidewalk may not be returned to concrete until the Spring    We did request National Grid try to restore the sidewalk by November 15th.    The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors     If at anytime the asphalt patch becomes unacceptable National Grid will be required to make repairs.  This includes the Winter period if need be.    The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair.    Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-11-09 08:07:41.11 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Department Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) has identified the sidewalk left in asphalt as belonging to Waveguide.    Sidewalks are required to be restored within 60 days.    This particular work was done within the last 3 weeks.    Since the Public Works has a moratorium on all permanent sidewalk repair work beginning in late November  this sidewalk may not be returned to brick until the Spring    The CIU Inspector had already informed Waveguide that the temporary asphalt patch was unacceptable.   They have been told they have to repair the patch by this Friday or we will suspend there ability to receive permits.    We are also working with them to have the brick restored before November 30th.    The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors.    The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair.    Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-11-16 08:44:13.067 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Mark Cardarelli contacted Eversource Electric and informed Eversource that the vault at 88 St Stephens needed repairs ASAP.       Eversource  stated that these are not easy repairs to make.    The covers have to be fabricated and the work itself is tedious.      Eversource  estimates that it is a minimum of 6 weeks and usually much longer before a  vault can be repaired    Eversource has been asked to at least make the area around the vault safe for pedestrian travels until a permanent repair can be made.    The CIU has added the location to its data base that tracks unacceptable utility work.    The CIU will monitor the progress of the work.     The  approaching Winter Moratorium  may push the work until next spring.    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

Staff from the Boston Public Works Department has reviewed the location and we are of the opinion that the location is a candidate for reconstruction.     Your request and location has been added to the master list of future reconstruction projects. Currently  the wait time for a reconstruction project of this nature can be up to five (5) or more years.    If you feel that there is an immediate safety concern at this location  please contact 617-635-4500 so that maintenance can be performed to make the location safer until the reconstruction can be started. CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-12-14 10:53:38.453 Case Noted Duplicate of Case #101000401390.    Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.    Staff from the Boston Public Works Department has reviewed the location and we are of the opinion that the location is a candidate for reconstruction.     Your request and location has been added to the master list of future reconstruction projects. Currently  the wait time for a reconstruction project of this nature can be up to five (5) years.     If you feel that there is an immediate safety concern at this location  please contact 617-635-4500 so that maintenance can be performed to make the location safer until the reconstruction can be started.    In the meantime  you may contact the Public Works Department Engineering Division at 617-635-4968 for information on your request.  Again  we appreciate and thank you for your interest in public safety and the welfare of your community.
SUBJECT: Public Works Department
